meanings.sent1: After eating a big meal, I was able to satiate my hunger.
meanings.sent2: She drank a glass of water to satiate her thirst.
meanings.sent3: The buffet was so delicious that I had to satiate my appetite with multiple trips.
meanings.sent4: Her love for reading could satiate her curiosity about the world.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies could easily satiate anyone's cravings.

meanings.definition: To supply with anything to excess.
meanings.sent1: The generous host tried to satiate his guests with an abundance of food.
meanings.sent2: The company aimed to satiate the market with their new product.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing basket of fruits was meant to satiate the monkeys' hunger.
meanings.sent4: The endless scrolling on social media can never truly satiate one's need for connection.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations were meant to satiate the party-goers' desire for fun.
